Reviews.Title: “S J Suites a bargain for one night”
Reviews.Author: Norb W
Reviews.Content: S J Suites is located in Old San Juan. It is an old converted warehouse, but very nicely done. It was clean, safe and a bargain for a one night pre cruise or post cruise. It is in walking distance to Pier 4, Carnival's departure pier. You are in the heart of Old San Juan for easy exploring by foot. A good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “SJ Hotel Success!”
Reviews.Author: frangalu
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in multiple locations in San Juan in the past, but we have never hit the jackpot, until now that is! We stayed at the SJ Suites with two other couples, it is clean, staff is very accomodating, and best of all it's location! Right in the middle of old San Juan, walking distance to everything. We did have to take a taxi to the Port for our cruise, but that's because we had 6 people with as much luggage.....we will stay here again when in Old San Juan...

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wcgmd
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, we were not expecting much. We got to the hotel after a short taxi ride from the airport. We stayed on the 5th floor and the junior suite we had was a room with a queen sized bed, a small desk and chair, and flat screen wall mounted TV. The bathroom was clean and good sized. What we love about the place is the LOCATION! Everything walking distance, restaurants, bars, cafes. We stayed for a few nights before going on to New York. Raymond at the reception area gave us ideas on what to do during our stay. Wish they put pictures or paintings on the walls in the room so its not so bare. An ice machine would also be nice. Anyway, for the price we paid, it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Lucky13-Greg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at S.J. Suites the night before our cruise. We checked in very late (3:30AM) due to an extremely delayed flight. This hotel had kept our room and were so nice when we showed up. The staff's recommendations for breakfast were spectacular. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “SJ Suites”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: Bot a very comfortable place. 2nd floor, has a slow elevator. But safe and clean. Nothing else to offer. Just a bed to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheLups
Reviews.Content: We stayed at S.J. Suites the night before our cruise and definitely recommend it as a pre-cruise stay choice. We checked in very late due to a late flight and they had no problem holding our room and were very pleasant when we checked in.The hotel is in the heart of OSJ which made our next day touring very easy! They allowed us to store our luggage after our check out so we could tour all day until we were ready to board the cruise ship.The hotel itself is very simple and the room and bathroom had the bare essentials but were both clean. The only issue we had was that my parents were staying at a different hotel and we made plans to call hotel to hotel to make plans to meet up the next morning and there was no phone in our hotel room (or alarm clock)! This was a first for me but the front desk staff were great and let me use their phone to make my calls. This is a great budget hotel in the middle of OSJ and it makes a great one nighter before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: bleep82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we left on a cruise and found this place to be perfect for that. Its certaintly nothing fancy but it was somewhere to store our luggage and rest. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. When we checked in we were given a map of Old San Juan and had all the sites and interesting places pointed out to us. We thought this was great and really helpful. The next day we were due to check out at 11am but our ship wasn't ready for boarding until 3pm so we asked if they had somewhere for us to store our luggage and were told we could stay in our room until we were ready to leave for the ship at no extra charge. The service at this hotel was fantastic and extremely friendly. The location is right in the heart of Old San Juan and everything you will want to see is within a few minutes walk. If you're not looking for luxury, and just want some where comfortable to sleep in a great location then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: Lyrad1949
Reviews.Content: First, the good things about our room. The bathroom was very good and clean. The rest of the hotel room was clean,as well as the Lobby. For the not so good, the room was smaller than I thought it would be. One member of our group had even a smaller room. They were not happy with their room. If you can, choose your room carefully. The worst thing about this hotel, was the outside of it. A set of barracades litter the front of the hotel. We thought maybe it was under construction, but it turns out only the owners are allowed to park there. This and the lack of maybe a new paint job really degrade this hotel. The location however, is just great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: Lovelake
Reviews.Content: When you need a room for a night, this is a place to go. Great location in old San Juan, centrally located. Nothing fancy, bed was comfortable. Entrance doors are kept locked, you need to be buzzed in. Desk is on the second level (elevator works, unlike some hotels in OSJ). Walls and doors are thin and sound travels quite well...we listened to an episode of NCIS from the next room. Fortunately, they turned the tv off at a reasonable hour.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need if only for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: laguida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night before heading off on a cruise the following day. The hotel is basic so don't expect much however it provided us with all that we needed for our brief stay. The rate for $140/n was a bit steep for what it was, but then again all hotels in San Juan are expensive on the weekends as thousands of other cruisers have the same idea and demand is high. The hotel has two main assets... 1. LOCATION Location location! To maximise time we wanted to stay in the heart of Old San Juan and the location can't be beaten for convenience. The hotel is situated on one of the most picturesque streets in the old town, well, they're all pretty picturesque but it's a beautiful street nevertheless. All the major sights of the old town are within easy walking distance and the Pan American Pier is only a 10min taxi ride away. 2. The staff are this hotel's other main asset. They were fantastic, very friendly and made us feel really welcome. They gave us some info on where to go in the old town, held our bags for a few hours after we checked out, just very friendly and helpful guys, service with a smile :) As for the building itself, it is quite old and when walking down the hallway it looked a bit like we were heading to a jail cell! But then once we opened the door to our room gave a sigh of relief to see that the room was actually nice and clean. It was a Junior Suite so a little on the small side as to be expected and had a window but the view was of nothing interesting, just a wall of a building. Our one main complaint would be that the walls are paper thin. If the next room is occupied and they are having a conversation, you can hear every single word, it sounds like they're actually in your room. If they even breathe you will hear it! So it doesn't feel very private when you can hear each other sooo well. And if they have their TV on whilst you want to go to sleep like our neighbours did....good luck getting to sleep. If you are starting or ending a cruise in San Juan then the old town is not to be missed, it is gorgeous! We were worried we wouldn't see all there is to see in one night and the majority of one day, but yes the old town is very small and it was more than enough time to appreciate it and see all the main sights. If staying for longer you would want to venture out. The hotel was adequate for just one night, super convenient and did the job. But if staying in San Juan for longer I agree with the previous reviewer and I'd also suggest staying elsewhere, unless you are a heavy sleeper and do not intend to spend much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Joan F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at S.J. Suites one night after our cruise and spent all day Sunday touring Old San Juan. The hotel was very clean and we enjoyed our stay. It is of course and old building so, if you want all the amenities that are offered in a large chain hotel, stay at one of those. This was just a simple but adequate place to stay a night and be within walking distance of all the sites in the old part of the city. The staff were helpful and directed us to the water ferry and private taxis to take us to the Bacardi site. It was a great trip and very cheap compared to what the cruise trip would have cost. Would stay at the S.J.Suites again if we are ever back to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “A Basic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mjm59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise. We only wanted someplace to sleep in Old San Juan. We don't require any frills. This hotel fit the bill. You have to ring a bell on the street to get in, then you're room key (and it is a real key) will unlock this and security doors on each floor. The rooms were basic and clean (some have small refrigerators). Some do not have windows and others have windows that are entirely opaque. There are no phones in the rooms so if you need something you have to go downstairs (don't forget your key or you can't get back up due to security doors) The location is right on Forteleza Street so it is in a great location for restaurants, bars and sightseeing. The people in OSJ are pretty friendly. The guys at the front desk were always nice and helpful. I probably wouldn't stay here for more than one or two nights, but for what we needed this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great for staying before cruise.”
Reviews.Author: Family5Missouri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before cruising to the southern carribean. Felt it was a good value and would stay there again. The staff were helpful. Only downside was no window in our room and the ability to hear our neighbors. This would not be a hotel to stay at if your neighbors were living it up.

Reviews.Title: “SJ Suites - Stayed here before a Royal Caribbean Serenade of the Seas 7 day cruise”
Reviews.Author: Cymix25
Reviews.Content: Very cheap - $125/night My wife and I wanted to go on a 7 day cruise out of Puerto Rico, but we wanted to experience Old San Juan for a few days before. I researched and researched hotels, and SJ Suites kept coming up. To be clear, this is not a 5-star hotel. Do not expect Ritz quality. This is a nice and quaint boutique hotel located smack in the heart of downtown Old San Juan. My wife and I went in with having an open mind and to not expect much, because after all you are on vacation and no need to stress over the small stuff. So with those remarks, I will go into detail about the hotel. When we landed at the SJU airport, we proceeded to walk outside to catch a cab. Cab fares are regulated in Puerto Rico and if I recall, it was about $22 total to get to Old San Juan from SJU for my wife and I and our 3 bags (they charge $1-$2 per bag per the regulation requirements on fares). The cab dropped us off in downtown Old San Juan, and there was SJU Suites. SJ Suites was hard to find and see at first, but it is there. If you can't find it, just ask around. The owner buzzed us in the front door and we proceeded up the elevator to the second floor. Yes, it has an elevator people. The owner checked us in (I forget his name) but he was very very nice. I asked him about things to do around town and he spoke with us for about 20 minutes asking what we wanted to do. Mainly we wanted to taste the food and explore the night life. We dropped our bags off in our room before we headed to lunch. Our room had a King bed, 2 night stands, a big closet, a chest of drawers, and a bathroom. It had everything we needed for the 1 night we were staying there before our cruise. Again, it was not Ritz quality, but there was nothing wrong with the room. Yes, there may have been some paint cracking on the walls and the bed spread was from the 90's, but I wasn't there for that. I needed a nice place to sleep that was safe and affordable. I am not going to criticize a hotel for paint cracking or an old bed spread, who cares? I do remember the Air Conditioning being very very cold. We had it on 78 and it was still freezing. I like the cold so I was fine, but the wife just got an extra blanket from the front desk and all was fine. It is better to have an AC that works than one that doesn't right? After we checked in, we went to lunch at Raices. There special drink was a mojito type drink in a tin can, and I suggest getting it. It is the best, I also suggest the plantains food. Raices was the best food I have tasted in a long long time. YOU MUST GO AND EAT HERE, IT IS AMAZING. Back to the hotel, we had a great time and slept great. We checked out and there were no issues at all with our stay. If we go back to Old San Juan, we will be staying here again for sure. If you are going to criticize a hotel for stupid things, than go stay down the street at the Sheraton or Ritz for $400+ a night. I on the other hand will stay at the SJ Suites hotel in my nice and cozy COLD room and save my $300+ difference a night to spend at Raices. :)

Reviews.Title: “Pay a little more and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Brienna_michele
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online, sight unseen except for online photos and upon the good reviews on Trip Advisor for cleanliness and safety. It was clean and it was safe. It was also a few other not so great things. This is an old apartment building that is being converted to a hotel. The rooms were strange feeling, as though renters had just moved out. There was no climate control so although the lobby and hotel hallways were cool the room was so hot that I sweated all night. I would have called down to the front desk but there is no phone in the room. The view from our hotel window scared me during the day and really freaked me out at night. It was of slum inner city housing not visible to tourists on the front block. There were people looking out from small decrepit windows directly across from our room. After falling asleep with a general feeling of creepiness, mind you part of the hotel is still under construction and you can see parts of it that look disturbing from the hallway, I vowed to write this review and never stay at this hotel again after seeing what else was available in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “All is Well...”
Reviews.Author: believer4ever
Reviews.Content: After a 7 day cruise, we stayed at the S&J Suites. I won't tell you the things that the other travelers have told you already. What I will tell you is that San Juan has many hotels, and most are 2 to 3 times the money. This hotel was in one of the best locations... San Juan is known as "the walkable city", and this hotel makes that possible. Yes, it is an older property, which means that it is not like the Sheraton down the street. But, it is clean, and has everything that you want. Ramone is one of the hotel assets. He is such a personable and friendly front desk manager, and is knowledgable of his city. He will do everything he can to accomodate you. I will tell you that we SO appreciated the willingness of the hotel to store our baggage ( we had quite a bit) until check in time. The hotel also did the same after check out, and called a cab for us to the airport. To be able to know your luggage can be stored in a secure location for free.... that is a great accomodation. Ramone also told us to go to the Barachinna ( sp?) 3 blocks down the street. It is the birthplace of the Pina Colada. You HAVE to go and try one.... even though my husband does not like coconut, he LOVED this one!!! It truly was the best I have ever tasted... all on Ramone's reccommendation. Also, there is a small cafe up one street and across from the Pidgeon Park... Cafeteria Mallorca. There is even a letter on the wall from Samantha Brown when she was traveling to San Juan... she reccommends it!! Do not be put off by the look of the cafe... the food is good. It is where the locals dine. All in all, the hotel is one that I would come back to.... there is more to a hotel than just it's looks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: GregandDiane
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, Raymond, who was extremely helpful with orientating us to the city, met us. He provided us with a map, lots of information about what to see, where to eat, and how to get around the city. The hotel is centrally located in Old San Juan, within walking distance to all of the attractions. Our room was on the back of the hotel, so it was quiet. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. At check out, Raymond stored our luggage for us so we could tour more of the city before we left. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LeeMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to our Caribbean cruise. The hotel is small and located above a jewellery store. There is only a small awning on the street to indicate that the hotel is there. The location is in an excellent area that is convenient to everything, and about dead center in the middle of old San Juan. You can walk everywhere from here. As other reviewers have said, you initially have to buzz to be let in and there are gates that are locked on each floor in the evening, but we appreciated that this was for the guest's security. We stayed on the 5th floor and found it quiet for the most part except for one noisy couple coming in at 2 a.m. and slamming doors. Our room was very spacious and had a king size bed, sofa, chair, wet bar area with mini fridge and a decent sized bathroom with the usual amenities. We found the room to be very clean, but not fancy. Raymond at the reception desk was very personable and always willing to make suggestions about good places to eat, give us information on taxi fares, and immediately attend to an issue we had with the air conditioning in our room. He recommended we eat at Raices and Latin Roots (roast pork at lunch), which were both excellent suggestions. We also ate at the Manolin just around the corner for breakfast and found it was the best and most reasonably priced breakfast we had while in OSJ. A taxi from the airport to the hotel was about $22 US and a taxi from the hotel to the Pan American Pier to our Celebrity ship was $18 per couple. If you are looking for fancy, perhaps the Sheraton is for you. For reasonable, budget minded travellers, this fit the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: buttersc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Old San Juan,PR. When you arrive at the front door of the hotel you have to ring the bell to be buzzed in because the door is locked at all times. I was concerned at first like other guests when we arrived at the front door but I think they have it that way so anyone just off the street can't walk into the hotel. They want it to be for guests only, which is a good thing. Great location as long as you don't mind walking. The room & bathroom was nothing fancy but was clean. We stayed here in August 2011 for just one night prior to our cruise but because the pier wasn't within walking distance, we had to take a taxi from the hotel to the Pan American Pier, this is where our ship was docked for Royal Caribbean. The staff was helpful in regards to helping us find places to eat, where to sight see, etc. This hotel is fine to stay in for one night prior to our cruise but if I was going to vacation here a whole week, I would stay somewhere else a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Al R
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights in room 403 at this hotel. When our taxi first arrived at the front door, we thought "what have we done"? But, once we got to the lobby (on the second floor) things improved greatly. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and informative. The room was very large, clean, and quiet. The only problem that we encountered was that the air conditioning made our room so cold one could have used it as a meat locker. There was no thermostat in the room and the staff had to adjust the temperature in the hall outside of our room. Also, the view from our room was horrible so we just kept the curtain closed. Although the cost was fairly high per night, when we checked with other hotels in the area we found that the price for the SJ Suites was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: strawberryfields52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Old San Juan, PR, withing walking distance from anything you may want to see. The room and bathroom were basic, but clean. Upon arrival we were given a map with a detailed explanation of the location of the major sites and advice on where to eat or drink, which was great. Other customers seemed to have complained about the noise from the street, especially on the weekend. We stayed there on Saturday night and did not hear anything, which made our stay pleasant. I recommend SJ Suites to anyone traveling on a budget and looking for a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: feti_11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was ideal. I spent two nights here and each morning there was no hot water to take a shower. In addition the hotel is not well insulated because I could hear music from the street being played well into the morning. The staff was helpful and claimed that they were surprised that there was no hot water. I really didn't believe them I got the feeling they knew the water was not hot. This hotel is very over priced and not worth the money. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Disappointed in Stay, but Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: chs80
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from reviews on Trip Advisor so I was really disappointed with our stay. The positives....The staff was very informative and friendly and gave great suggestions especially on our first check-in. (We stayed the day before our cruise and a day after). I would not have stayed the day after, but we booked with an on-line service and had to pre-pay. The location is great and we walked to everything in Old San Juan. One could walk to the cruise port as well, but with our luggage and the cobblestone streets, we did opt for a taxi to the ship. The negatives: The first night we had a joining room and the door was locked, but the other guests were VERY noisy, you could hear everything!! They kept rattling the door...maybe they did not realize there was a bedroom on the other side? I didn't want to complain to them, because I didn't want to make the matter worse. There is no front desk staff there during overnight hours. That was Room 303. The room itself was clean, good shower, no window though, not a big deal about the window. On our return, room 301 was a larger room, just off the elevator. The window was open at the bottom about an inch and was really afraid to try to close it, due to age of windows. Did bring it to the attention of the front desk. Really did not look like an easy repair. Room was very hot (they did adjust the a/c) but the room was very noisy from street traffic and pedestrian traffic all night long. Coffee was available in the lobby in the morning, but not much else. There are restaurants within walking distance though. There are other properties in the area which are in the same price-range that we will try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Read their cancellation policy carefully before you book”
Reviews.Author: TexasCommunicator
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation for one might. It was paid at the time of the reservation. I had to cancel my reservation, and although I canceled more than 3 weeks ahead of the arrival date, they have refused to refund my money. So read their cancellation policy carefully and do not book here unless you are absolutely certain you can go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, great location, very friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dransfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in total and will stay again on my next visit to beautiful San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sunsher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. I love Old San Juan and this hotel was right in the middle of it all. The entrance is a little strange because the outside door is locked and you have to ring a bell to get in. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. What more could you ask for? You couldn't beat the price compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrade
Reviews.Content: No, it's not the Ritz, but it is a nice funky hotel in a GREAT location...reminded me of an old European hotel. It is an old converted office building with only 24 rooms, but they are large with modern bathrooms. Your old-fashioned key...yes, a real key...gets you in the secure front door and into your room. There is no telephone in the room...big deal...everyone has a cell. The desk clerk gave us excellent recommendations for sight-seeing and restaurants within easy walking distance. His recommendation for breakfast was your basic diner frequented by many locals and a few tourists. The coffeemaker was 104 years old .. delicious. Breakfast for two: Pancakes, two rashers of bacon, coffee (for one), and freshly squeezed orange juice (for one) was thirteen dollars. Try to get that at the Ritz! We were truly in the heart of Old San Juan and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Urlauberforever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the S.J. Suites for two nights in December and were very pleased by this hotel. The beds were great and the rooms clean but the best was the great location directly in Old San Juan. If you want to pay not so much money but still have all places in walking distance this is a great choice. Due to the central location some people might have problems with noice, we did not. The desk was very helpful and explained all about Old San Juan, where to eat and dance and where to enjoy the best rum. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A utility player: clean, safe, quiet, good value”
Reviews.Author: childbride84
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights before venturing on to other parts of the island. Old San Juan can be very exciting (read: loud) on weekends, but our guest room on the third floor was whisper quiet. The accommodations aren't lavish, and they're not especially stylish either. But it's a good place to get a good night's rest. Our room was a little on the cold side, as there didn't seem to be a way to control the temperature individually. It did have a pull-out sofa, mini-fridge and wet bar. The lighting was a bit strange, reminiscent of the places American Apparel ads seem to be shot. It's an easy walk to all of the Old San Juan attractions, including the forts and the cruise ships. For the price and location, definitely worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short-term stay”
Reviews.Author: Impslave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night prior to our cruise. We had one of the king suites, and we were very pleased with the condition of the room and the overall service. Upon arriving, Raymond at the front desk greeted us warmly and pointed out key spots for us on a map of Old SJ. He gave us recommendations for dinner that night and breakfast the next day. When we got to the room, I was thrilled with how big it was. I had read here about the lack of natural light (there was only one smallish window), but that is perfect for us. The bed and linens were clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was just fine and stocked with towels and toiletries. After a quick breakfast at a cafe around the corner (Raymond's recommended spot was way too crowded), we checked out just before noon. We had no trouble with our request to place our bags in a secure location until we were ready to go to our ship. This gave us the chance to walk around Old SJ and do a little shopping. When we were ready to go to the pier, we retrieved our luggage and the front desk guy (name escapes me) was happy to call a cab for us. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and we had a great stay. I'm not sure if this would be the place for us for a longer stay of a few days or more, but it's perfect for that day or two before or after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for overnight stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: Sk13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before leaving on a cruise. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room (520) had a couch/sitting area, king size bed, mini fridge/wet bar area. We did not have a street view so we found the room to be extremely quiet and had a great night's sleep, never heard the other guests even thought the hotel was at full capacity when we stayed here. The location is excellent, right in the heart of Old San Juan within easy walking distance to Plaze de Armes, San Cristobal Castle and the cruise ship pier. The sidewalks between this hotel and the cruise pier are much wider than some of the other streets so it made it easy for us to walk with our luggage. Checkout wasn't until noon and after that they held our luggage in a secure room in the back. I felt very safe at night walking back to the hotel. They do have gates in the hallways as mentioned in previous reviews but from the inside you can open the gates without a key so the perceived "fire hazzard" I do not believe is valid and it feels like an extra layer of security if you are concerned about that (from the street you need the key or to be buzzed in by the front desk so it's already pretty secure). Although, again, the location did not feel unsafe even without the added security. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance as well. Taxi from airport to this hotel cost $19 + $1 for each bag. I would definitely stay here again before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value; great location”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: I would simply reiterate what virtually EVERYONE has already said in this forum. This hotel is extremely well situated to do everything in Old San Juan. It is not deluxe, but the rooms are very spacious and clean and the front desk quite helpful. Although we arrived late evening and were concerned about walking around in a "strange" city, we had no reason to fear; this area is very safe and well protected. Everything is within walking distance, and the price is reasonable. We would have preferred more windows in our room, and the air conditioning was not adjustable within the room, so at times we were not as comfortable as we might have been otherwise. All in all, we would be happy to stay there again. P.S. Wireless worked great (and free).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Hersheylocal
Reviews.Content: After some difficulties getting accurate information from the overnight clerk, the day time manager saved the day. The room was very clean and the hotel is within walking distance of everything in Old San Juan. If you are cruising and want to visit the city before disembarking this is well worth it. Good security system in place too.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located to so many things in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Elsienette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to our cruise. Want to say this now because it is VERY IMPORTANT!!! DO NOT LISTEN TO ANYONE WHO SAYS YOU CAN WALK TO THE CARNIVAL PIER 4 WITH YOUR LUGGAGE UNLESS YOU ONLY HAVE A BACKPACK (which I doubt) -- the sidewalks and foot traffic could not let this readily happen. Instead, have the front desk call you a cab. We checked in and set out on foot to the left and above the hotel (not sure of the NSEW part). We toured looked at the outside of the Cristobal fort and the capitol bldg and looked at the ocean and scouted out where we'd have dinner (we decided on El Jibato - 280 Calle Sol - enjoyed our food) . The staff at SJ Suites is wonderful! The three men we interacted with were super helpful, friendly and welcoming. We were able to leave our bags in a storage room after check out for most of the day while we visited the El Morro fort (I felt in love with its historic beauty) and areas to the right and above. Close to Marshall's (found a bathing suit which is out of season here in PA), a SuperMax grocery store for snacks (try the Munch peanut bars and Bueno bars), Starbucks, Wendy's, Subway, Mc D's (not sure of their hrs), a Radio Shack (memory cards anyone?) and 2 drug stores and various souvenir shops. I could go on and on about the area as we were not lacking for anything we would/could want. Now the few bad things about the room. 1) it was colder than we'd prefer - this was easily fixed by an adjustment the gentleman at the front door did (he also gave us extra blankets when I asked). 2) the rooms are a little darker and mostly lit by lamps - it's an older building and that happens sometimes. 3) the walls are thinner and I could hear my neighbors talking - problem solved with earplugs I made sure to bring. 4) Room/bed/shower/common areas were all clean BUT the room did have a musky smell - problem altered by a spray or two of body spray. Bottom line, I loved the area and I liked the hotel very much and would consider staying again. I enjoyed the added security I felt in needing to be buzzed into the building and needing a key to get into the area of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great, central location”
Reviews.Author: jck123123
Reviews.Content: Wanted a 2 night stay in the heart of Old San Juan, and stayed here. The room was clean, water hot, and bed comfortable. Very friendly staff. The location is the main reason to stay. Center of everything. We did not want to have to get a car and were able to walk to everything. Very nice and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bridiep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SJ Suites for one night prior to taking cruise. The location is excellent for wandering around Old San Juan, which was exactly what we were looking for. There was a street festival going on the night we arrived, but was just up the road from the hotel so wasn't too intrusive. Our room was large, air-conditioned and clean. The staff were friendy and accommodating. They were very happy to store our bags for us after check-out so we could explore Old San Juan before boarding our ship. Don't bother with the breakfast, as there is a great little cafe one block away that does a good breakfast. It was stuffed with locals, so you know it has to be good! All in all, the hotel was great value for what we paid for it. For a basic, no-frills, one-night stop-over in Old San Juan, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet place to stay at the heart of Old San Juan, especially for cruisers.”
Reviews.Author: ahouse09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good location, great value, quiet, and felt safe. The staff was very friendly, especially Raymond who was incredibly helpful, recommending restaurants, shopping, and attractions that captured the heart of Old San Juan. My husband and I were traveling with another couple and we both had spacious, comfortable 2 room suites. If you are looking for a place to stay a couple of nights before a cruise this is the place for you. The beds were comfortable, the water pressure was good, and we had a small fridge in our room to store drinks. We were able to explore San Juan, as everything is in walking distance, including night life down by the harbor. We were also able to walk to the pier the next day to embark upon our cruise. (Make sure you check which pier your ship is leaving from prior to doing this. There are piers on the other side of the harbor.) They provided a locked room for our luggage to be stored so we could sightsee after check out. There are very few amenities such as no coffee maker in the room, but they do have one in their lobby. We did not have much of a view from our window, but this wasn't important to us. This was a great value and we would stay here again before a future cruise.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION!!!!!!!! INCREDIBLE HOSPITALITY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: delaama0802
Reviews.Content: Some rooms have no windows (if you like to sleep with the AC REALLY cold and a dark room.... this is for you) very large rooms. Incredible location, we were informed of all the best places to go, they accomadated us in EVERY which way!!! very very thankful

Reviews.Title: “Good for cruisers-very good location”
Reviews.Author: chic09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, right in the heart of Old San Juan, good for cruisers. We reserved for only one night. We were able to walk to the Pier with our luggage. We were accommodated in a suite. The room was clean but dark and had a funny musty smell. If you are looking for one or two nights is OK. Old San Juan does not have many selections of Hotels and I find them overprized for the quality

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: taj-jackson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed at the SJ Suites for 1 night before departing for a cruise out of San Juan. All of us thought the hotel was clean, friendly and was a great value. We enjoyed staying in Old San Juan and the convenience of the restaurants and nightlife in the evening followed by the shops and sightseeing during the day. True, the TV didn't have reception, but I can watch TV at home. We stayed out late and got up early. The staff was very friendly. They provided us with a safe room for a luggage in the morning so we could venture out. I will certainly stay with SJ Suites before our next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative reviews - lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kes6684
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the SJ Suites one night, before we left for a cruise. It was a wonderful hotel. If you're expecting 4 stars, you will be disappointed, but it's a clean hotel with an AMAZING location, which you can't beat. The rooms were large, clean, and comfortable. We had a very long day of traveling (our original flight was canceled, & we dealt with delays all day) & we were so happy to arrive & clean up. The staff was really friendly, & recommended some great places to eat & walk. The bathroom was very nice, with a built in hairdryer. The shower was clean. The room didn't offer a great view, but you shouldn't be spending much time in your room with so much to do just steps away from the hotel. Walking around at night was fine, we felt very safe. There was a lot going on down by the harbor, with a lot of locals and tourists walking around. Don't miss down by the water at night, it was lovely. The bed was a little hard for my taste, but we slept wonderfully - very quiet. We walked around in the morning & the staff stored our luggage in a locked room so we didn't have to worry about toting it around after checking out. We really can't say enough about the staff - the front desk manager insisted we take a cab to our ship (we were going to walk) which saved us - it was a long, long, LONG walk, being that our ship was on the other side of the harbor. He even took time out of his lunch break to help us hail a cab. Very friendly, accommodating. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Reminder read this policy....This hotel will not refund cancellations... even if you are held back by the weather”
Reviews.Author: pumakitty
Reviews.Content: We got held back from our honeymoon and had to cancel flight, cruise, and our one night stay in this hotel because our airlines was unable to accomodate our travel plans due to the weather.... we were only staying here one night to prevent any inclement weather issues we booked a day ahead.... this hotel would not refund our stay for the night.

Reviews.Title: “S.J. Suites was a perfect place to stay in Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Skybird7
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in Old San Juan. By comparison, we stayed in Da House Hotel last year, and while beautiful, Da House had no breakfast, was VERY noisy, and the staff were not friendly or very helpful. Our friends stayed at the Sheraton while we were at S.J. Suites Hotel and we used their pool with them, which otherwise we might have missed as S.J. Suites has no pool. The GREAT things about this hotel are: 1) the location is dead center of old San Juan - it's great for easy access to everywhere in the city. 2) The rooms are completely quiet, so you will sleep SOUNDLY! This is worth a lot as we learned from staying at Da House last year that the city can be LOUD at night! 3) The staff were very kind and helpful. Luis, the front desk person, always greeted us by asking how our adventures of the day had gone and offering us anything we needed. 4) The queen suite that we were in had a whole living room in addition to the bedroom! Lots of space! Now, be prepared to make some compromises for those great benefits, such as: 1) Very little natural light (request a room with a window since some rooms don't have a window at all) 2) Very ordinary furnishings (comfortable and very clean, though!) 3) The breakfast is very minimal - basically grilled cheese and cold cut sandwiches, coffee and juice. All the same, I have thoroughly explored the options for lodging in old San Juan and I believe this is the best all around package at this price point. We loved our stay and look forward to returning one day.

Reviews.Title: “" A SCAM"”
Reviews.Author: Loosahn
Reviews.Content: This is false advertising that needs to discontinue. This place should not be listed as a hotel. There is NO: WINDOW; AIR CONDITION IN THE HALLWAY; PHONE IN THE ROOMS; CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST (bread, juice, jelly, over-processed cheese, milk, cereal); Items are highly rationed (soap); NO SHOWER CAP, RAZOR, ETC., ROOM SERVICE; CABLE (TV has 5 channels). When you leave your room, the hallway air is hot and thick, since it isn't air-conditioned. The air is controlled by the front desk clerk, and the temperature was always set at freezing. I had to purchase a sweater at Marshall's. The elevator is extremely small (will hold approximately two persons (without luggage). You have to make several trips with your luggage. The place is always quiet because there are only a FEW guests at any given time. ALL of the employees look shady. NOT IN COMPLIANCE WITH FIRE CODE: On each floor there are heavy iron gates that are locked 24/7. You have to unlock the gate before you can get to your room. If there is a fire at any time (night or day), You can find yourself having difficulty trying to get out, since you may not have the time to get to your key to unlock the iron gate.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay to explore old san juan”
Reviews.Author: zand05
Reviews.Content: s.j. suites met all our needs and more while in san juan. it was close to the port where our cruise ship came in and best of all was perfectly located to walk all of old san juan. many excellent restaurants were just down the street and it was only about 10 min walk to the fort. the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. gave us maps of the area, recommended restuarants and sight seeing. let us leave our luggage until we could board our ship, called a taxi and etc.our room was large (2 rooms actually) but without a window. this was actually a good thing as it reduced noise. furnishings were a little sparse but clean and in good order. considering that this hotel is considerably less than others in old san juan and in a perfect location, we would definately go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karma1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of San Juan. It's on the perfect spot. The room was great! It was big for what you usually get. The price was also excellent. The staff was very friendly and willing to help or give ideas on what to do or places to visit. I would go back in a heartbeat. It doesn't have a pool, but if you really don't mind...it is the perfect spot to adventure in Old San Juan..;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: bdbutterfly
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, great service and beautiful accommodations. In the heart of Old San Juan this small hotel features beautifully decorated rooms and helpful staff. Would surely recommend it to anyone. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: pikew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights (Fri. & Sat.) at S. J. Suites in late April prior to our cruise. We were in room 304. The room actually consisted of 2 rooms; a bedroom (and bathroom), and a sitting room with a small refrigerator. There was a couch and a small table in the sitting room. The television was in the bedroom. Thereâ€™s no telephone in the room, but this wasnâ€™t a problem since the front desk let us use their phone when we needed to make a call. The room also didnâ€™t have a window, but I believe this was actually a good thing since we didnâ€™t hear any noise coming from the street. Besides, we werenâ€™t staying there for the view â€“ just a place to lay our weary heads for a few hours. A breakfast of breads/juices/cheese/meats was also provided. There's a small elevator in the hotel so you don't have to drag your luggage up the stairs. We found the staff at the hotel (Rubin & Maria) to be quite friendly and accommodating. The hotel has an excellent location â€“ right in the heart of Old San Juan. There are many stores on the surrounding streets. As well you are within walking distance of both forts and the cruise ship pier. We walked to the cruise ship (with our luggage) in about 10 minutes. It was easy since itâ€™s downhill! Without hesitation we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, some foibles”
Reviews.Author: MissFidget
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed 2 nights at the SJ Suites. The location in Old San Juan was fantastic. The staff is incredibly friendly. The price was quite reasonable compared to the quotes I was getting elsewhere. I would recommend it if you don't care about the beach or the pool. We knew we'd be getting that elsewhere on our vacation. The drawbacks - our room, which comfortably accommodated 2 double beds and a double inflatable mattress, had no windows and we couldn't control the temperature. It was chilly all the time. They happily provided extra blankets. but the effect was kind of strange when you got outside and hit the heat and sunshine. A positive of this is that the room was very quiet. While we were there they had a problem with the water in Old San Juan, one morning we only had a trickle, and then we had a request to minimize our use of water. One last picky thing - during our entire stay there was a piece of gum stuck to a statue in the hall. I was pretty surprised that no one cleaned it up.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: merrican
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews here are quite accurate, except for the amount of noise. We stayed here one night before our cruise, which was a Saturday, then another night after the cruise (Sunday). We came with another couple. Between the two couples we stayed in rooms 301, 401 & 501, which are all on the street side. The first night (Saturday) was extremely noisy. People yelling, singing, fighting, cars honking, screeching, police sirens, car alarms, etc. all until about 4:30 a.m. Very noisy. I finally fell asleep around 4:30, but that's also when I remembered that I had earplugs, which helped. The Sunday that we stayed there was slightly less noisy, but still heard all of the above, except the fighting. Again I didn't get much sleep...would start to doze when a car alarm or something else would go off. I had a look at the rear rooms (which were about $300/night). They are exactly like the front rooms, except more floor space. The one I saw had no view, but I'm sure would have been quieter. I thought the beds were just ok...nothing special. If you ask the front desk to adjust the air conditioning, they will. The service and friendliness of the hotel was exceptional. The location also was absolutely perfect. We could walk anywhere in Old San Juan without any problems. We took our luggage down to the pier from the hotel on the first day of our cruise (downhill), which was fine, but hired a taxi ($12) from the cruise ship back up a week later. I don't think I would stay here again (having already toured the area once), but would recommend it for someone that could pay to have a back room. I think it's very expensive for what you get, but in comparison to all of the other hotels it's probably pretty average. Location is great, but expect noise, traffic, and lots of happy people!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsumathguy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, small hotel located in the heart of Old San Juan. We booked directly with the hotel and found them to be very easy to deal with at all times. The rooms are not fancy, but for us we spend very little time in our room so this is not an issue. The rooms are extremely clean and the bed was comfortable. We were lucky enough to have room 501 with a street view. We never tried the breakfast so cannot comment on that. There are many restaurants and bars nearby. You can walk to the piers and the forts in 10 minutes or less. The only bad thing about this property is there is no on site parking so you have to get lucky if you decide to drive (which you should not do if you can avoid it). We were able to find street parking both nights, but if you can't then you need to park in a nearby garage (not likely to be too cheap). Just a quick tip on something to do. Take a drive to the area known as Pinones. It is just east of Isla Verde (maybe 15 minute drive from Old SJ). Here you will find dozens of food and beer vendors. It might be tough to find someone who speaks english, but you will have a wonderful time and will not spend much money while taking in some real Puerto Rican culture. You can sit on the beach and enjoy your snacks and an ice cold Medalla. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: paulymk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre cruise in Aug 2006. For our 2007 visit wanted to try Hotel Milano, since everyone on Trip Advisor rated it pretty high. After checking the room at the Hotel Milano and seeing how poor the beds were we went right back to SJ Suites. They could not get us a room for Sunday night but were able to get us in from Monday to Wednesday. Room307 faces Fortelaza Street, is a very nice room, has a fairly firm bed, but since it faces the street you do hear the noise and traffic, and loud car radios. However, the staff at SJ Suites is fantastic. During the day there is Maria who is so pleasant and friendly and in the evening there was Ruben, also quite friendly. The only drawback, and it is not a biggy, is that the rooms do not have individual air conditioning control. If you call the desk they will try and adjust it to satisfy your needs. SJ Suites wins hands down against the Hotel Milano so don't was your time and money at the Milano when just down the street is one of the nicest places in Old San Juan. Paul and Liz - Long Island, NY

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Hotel Perfctly Situated”
Reviews.Author: jeko
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in early August. I want to avoid re-hashing the last few reviews. They all seem pretty accurate in facts, differing mainly in the expectations of their authors. Here are the salient additions from our perspective. SERVICE & MARIA . Maria is the front desk attendant from 7AM to 6PM -- incredible. She is sunny, bright, and very helpful -- both as to matters of the hotel and the city. She went out of her way to make calls in advance and have excursions, fees, transoprtation options, maps, brochures, etc., to give us when we arrived. The night staff are from an outside contractor, so their helpfulness is variable. Based on the other helpful reviews, we just figured that we were on our own after 6. I think it might be more accurate to look at the accomodations as somewhere between an apartment and a hotel. THE LOCATION. It is perfect (if you want to be in Old San Juan) -- situated right in the midst of the main street of Old SJ, Calle Fortaleza. Most of the better restaurants are on that street. The rest are an easy 3-4 block walk from there. It is very easy to hail a taxi at all hours. HOTEL. We saw two rooms b/c the first was in the back and the entire back hall was very musty at the time. We were moved one of the rooms in the front of the hotel, those facing Calle Fortaleza. I thnk there is only room in front per floor. Ours was 401. Unlike the suites in the back, this one was one large room, which was fine. Very pretty view to the street. Our experience was that as a rule, Old San Juan does not sleep. There was street noise until 4 AM each night. This did not really bother us, b/c we both like a little street noise. However, one night, the people in the apt. directly across the street from us (on the same floor) had an all night party with all the fixin's (i.e., alcohol, music, etc). There was very little sleep that night. As to the hotel itself, the hotel is pretty basic, but they have painted it in tasteful earth tones and with sparse but attractive local furniture. Neither of our rooms had baths, just showers. FINDING THE HOTEL. The hotel is near impossible to spot unless you have seen it once before. The facade is non-descript, yellow, and identified with small letters. Moreover, it is a very narrow facade and easy to miss. Would be sure to have the address handy when first arriving. It is almost directly across the street from a very nice linen store, which I believe is called "The Linen Place." Overall, we liked the hotel very much and would return. Would not recommend it if you prefer resort-style service and accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariagonzalezh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this Hotel this past month, our experience was more than great. When we arrived, there was a very nice girl in the front desk who showed us to our room. The rooms were very big and very comfortable. We stayed for two nights. Eventhough the temperature in our room was very nice there wasn't any individual thermostats in the room, sure this wasn't a problem because the front desk employees offered to help if we needed it colder or hotter. The rooms are very nicely decorated, they include a mini-fridge full of sodas, water and juices and a basket with chips and snacks(that was not included in the room rate). The attention was great, there was always someone willing to help. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but it has a great localitation. Down the street you find all sorts of restaurants, the front desk reserved it for us and help us to get there. We also asked for a gym because we train every day, and there is one a building away. Overall we were extremely satisfied with the service, the hospitality and the prices. When we go back to Puerto Rico this is were we are staying. Cozy, personalized service, what else can you ask for!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: jziock
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of our honeymoon in S.J. Suites. The help at the front desk was very nice, the room was a basic clean hotel room. We had a window overlooking the street however and we stayed on a Saturday night. All night there were very loud noises from the street below. I don't know if it's because the windows are thin or old but whatever the reason I found it very annoying to be kept away throughout much of the night and people were still partying when we left for the airport at 5:20AM. After getting back I found out that we had been charged for the little pack of bathroom supplies which had no markings on them that they cost money (the mini bar with snacks is clearly marked) and that they had charged us twice. When I called they said it was because we had taken them from 2 different rooms, that we had changed rooms while we were there. We definitely did not change rooms while we were there and as of yet both charges are still on my credit card. Overall, it was a relatively inexpensive hotel room in a good location but I don't know why it deserves such high praise that others have given it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit quirky with an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: LAinLC
Reviews.Content: [note: a little long] I selected the S.J. Suites after trying to reserve a room at the Hotel Milano, which was booked. I really wanted to be in Old San Juan for at least part of my trip (a vacation), so I decided to take a chance on this relatively unknown hotel. I stayed in room 401, facing Calle de la Fortaleza. The windows open, fortunately, because I tend to micro-manage the temperature, and the room lacks a thermostat. Although Fortaleza has some of the best restaurants in San Juan and plenty of activity, the street was pretty quiet by 10 p.m. The room was large; the double bed was very comfortable. One reviewer said the sheets felt damp, but I didn't find that to be the case (and I'm pretty picky). The room had plenty of light. The wet bar area provided additional counter space and a dorm room-sized refrigerator. The fridge was packed with drinks, but I see no reason why you couldn't remove them and store your own items. [There are 2 drugstores and a market on Plaza de Armas if you're inclined to stock up on water and the like]. The desk was very small, more of a table. The bathroom was also small, and the shelves were quite high if you're under about 5'2". The shower pressure was terrific, plenty of hot water, and the toilet worked fine. Sharing the bathroom could be a bit tricky, however, there's a medicine cabinet behind the mirror, which helps. The hotel did not have washcloths, so bring your own if that matters to you. I had no problems with the housekeeping service and certainly didn't see any bugs! The continental breakfast is really really basic -- coffee, OJ, cold cereal, bread for toast, small (but very good) pastries, and slices of ham and cheese. The coffee was fine. La Bombonera is one block up from the hotel, as the crow flies, and has mallorcas, eggs, and coffee con leche, plus a more "local" ambience. [an aside: if you've eaten at Canter's Deli on Fairfax in L.A., you'll find the service at La Bombonera very familiar]. In sum, nothing fancy or substantial about the breakfast. Ruben, who works the front desk overnight, is very helpful. It's true that the hotel does not have full time front desk service, so you do need to time your requests. Now, about some of the things people have mentioned: 1. Air-conditioning -- On the 4th floor, room 405 is on one control; the rest of the rooms are on the other control. Ruben did adjust the temp when asked, and there is a way adjust it yourself, if need be (I'm reluctant to say so, for fear that the owners will make it impossible!). 2. The rooms in back of the hotel face the back of some pretty ugly buildings. It's a good idea to ask: (a) whether your room has a window; and (b) what direction the room faces. 3. There are no phones in the rooms. Bring a cell phone! 4. Security is quite good. No one can enter the building without a key (room keys open the front door). 5. The t.v. has only a few channels. 6. The location was perfect. Close to the waterfront, restaurants, shops, everything in OSJ. 7. The rates were decent, not great. 8. It's a little tricky for taxis to find: It's across from Payless Shoes, between the Doll House and Kury's Jewelry (the Kury family owns S.J. Suites). In sum, the S.J. Suites worked fine for the 4 nights I spent there, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again (especially now that I know its quirks).

Reviews.Title: “Don't say I didn't warn you!”
Reviews.Author: Guliverstravels
Reviews.Content: Most of the rooms have no windows (that's right); there is no control over the temperature in the room (it is set floor by floor by management); the staff are friendly however there is only a day shift (8am - 6pm), afterwards a night guard sits in the stairwell; if you have a problem after 6pm, then you live with the problem until the next morning. The cancelation policy is very restrictive. On the brighter side, it is well-situated in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Best PR experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ralph27
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the SJ Suites was a remarkable experience. This boutique hotel is located in the heart of Old San Juan, the rooms are new, and the staff is always willing to please you. The rates are really great, so it is a Best Buy!!! It also has a great jewlry store in the first floor of the building. The next time I travel to PR, I will stay again at the SJ Suites. Ralph Janes, Marthas Vineyard

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: DCSM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night after ending a cruise. we picked it because of the location. we wanted to spend the day in old san juan and thought that the close proximity would be nice. it was! it is on a great main street in old town and we took a "walking tour" outlined by the frommers website. we were within walking distance of everything. we arrived at the hotel at around 11am (our taxi driver didn't know exactly where it was, but we had the hotel phone number and she called for directions. just know that it is literally half a block from hotel milano and it will be easy to locate). anyway, we got there at 11am and the put us right in a room even though checkin wasn't until 3pm. the room was great. no, it didn't have a window (though some of the rooms do), but it was a HUGE room. for one night it really wasn't noticable. we were cold, so we asked the guy to turn the airconditioning down, which he promptly did. we had a queen bed suite and i cannot stress how large the two rooms were! the bathroom was small, but very clean. we were pleased witht he friendlienss of the staff, the size and cleanliness of the rooms,a nd overall the fabulous location! it was such a great location. there was a culinary and music fest going on when we were there and we could walk to all the action. the only complaint is the breakfast. packaged honeybuns, bread you could toast, and very bad coffee with no real cream or milk to put in it. but that is my only complaint. for the price and location, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: bakery
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the S.J. Suites for one night pre-cruise in March. Based on some of the earlier reviews, I had expected a little nicer place. But in a city where every other hotel was either priced stratospherically or got dodgy reviews, it wasn't bad at all. We were in one of the windowless rooms, which I didn't mind, but the room temperature was unbelievably freezing! (Wish I'd figured out how to change it like the earlier reviewer did!) The location was fantastic. I loved being in the middle of old San Juan, being able to walk to El Morro, to our ship, and to a great restaurant (the Kafe Puerto Rico, on Calle O'Donnell). In short, the hotel was very average, but the location was so good that it's worth overlooking for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to be right smack in the middle of Old San Juan, this is the place for you. It is literally located over some shops on a popular shopping street. The ports are three blocks away. There are restaurants everywhere you turn. And you can walk to sites like El Morro and St. Cristobal and the governor's mansion. The bad thing is that the hotel is far from nice, if you're used to hotels like Hilton or Ramada or even Howard Johnson. Instead of the hotel feel, it feels like you're staying in the guest bedroom of someone's home. It doesn't even look like a hotel; the place resembles (and may very well be) an office that's been converted. To get to the front desk, you have to press the buzzer at a nondescript door from the street and take the elevator to the second floor. If for some reason there's no one at the front desk to buzz you in, a sign tells you to go into the jewelry store next door and use their phone to call someone to come open the door. (But once you've checked in, you get your own key to open the front door.) The free breakfast consisted of bread that you can toast, individually wrapped Little Debbie-type pastries that you can heat up in the microwave, Oscar Mayer ham slices, and Kraft singles, plus tea, juice, and coffee (but it WAS free). The room that we stayed in, the furniture, and the bathroom all looked and felt worn. There was some street traffic noise coming in through the windows. However, everything was clean and the bedsheets were supersoft. And if you're not planning to stay in your room very much, then this place serves the purpose of being centrally located just fine. Really, the location is unbeatable. I'm guessing that's why the place has gotten so many nice reviews. If you don't care about cushiness, then it's quite perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location Near Cruise Ships and Great Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: 59Barbi
Reviews.Content: This is not El Convento,but neither is the price.This is the next best option in old town. 2 blocks from Cruise terminal. Rooms on street can be noisy and I agree about air conditioning; they did adjust it when asked. Breakfast is meager, but there is a great Puerto Rican "diner" around corner by Radio Shack which is GREAT! All the best restaurnats are 2-3 blocks up the street. There is a night watchman. Yes there is a bad view room (see Pictures)and a windowless room, but I would stay there again. Had a massage with Bill Carr [" "]who they recommended; he will come to hotel or you can go to his place near El Convento. Hot rocks, reflexology, massage all in one for only $40. It was so great I gave him a huge tip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, depressing room”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeUser
Reviews.Content: We had one of the windowless suites. Concrete walls, sparse furnishings, tiny bathroom. Only good for sleeping - and that somewhat a problem because there is one locked thermostat for the whole floor (fortunately we figured out how to access and adjust it!) One advantage of a tomb-like atmosphere -- it was QUIET, and once we got the temperature right, slept very well. The lobby lounge was an okay option for reading without being claustrophobic. Breakfast also not much -- fortunately the location of SJS is great, lots of places in neighborhood to eat, from a local bakeries to a better than usual Starbucks. Excellent lunch and dinner options as well. Front desk very helpful in suggesting restaurants, arranging transport etc. Bottom line is that this would not be our choice when we return to SJ, but if you want or need to be downtown, it is acceptable and if we hadn't expected more (per some of the reviews below) might have been less disappointed. Note also, if you come by cab, it is not well known or marked; you need to have your address handy and eyes pealed.

Reviews.Title: “GREEEEEAAAATTTTT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice personnel, outstanding service, reasonable prices. I'll be back next summer for SoFo, a curinary festival I just missed.

Reviews.Title: “Not your 5 star Hotel, but certainly does the trick!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at Sj suites. It is a very good hotel. Very clean and very secure. I went to San Juan for business, so it was a bit of a problem because they didn't have telephones in the rooms, but I managed and the staff was so nice that this problem didn't seem to matter. I recommend highly recommend this hotel, is very peaceful. It will be even better if it had a restaurant or bar inside, but they are young, so I guess plans are still in the making.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sj suites has a little bit of everything you need to have a comfortable stay in Old San Juan. Itâ€™ strategic location places you within steps of OSJ mayor attractions. This hotel is small, but very clean and elegant, we had no complaints. Staff is very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, exelent service, in the center of all San juan.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you're traveling on business or pasing by the old San Juan. The rooms are fully furnished, Basic cable and Air conditioned (although there's no controls for it). Some rooms have windows that open have a direct view of calle la fortaleza. Comveniently located in the center of old San Juan, where all the shops and turism atractions are. This is a real good place to stay at if you really want to experience old San Juan. My only complain is the lack of parking. It's a little bit of a hazzle to find parking there but not imposible. People traveling only to old San Juan wont have a problem because this hotel is walking distance from everything.

HotelInfo.Name: S.J. Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Fortaleza St. #253 | Old San Juan, San Juan 00901, Puerto Rico
